markdown: <::logo: Takeda Pharmaceuticals North America, Inc. Takeda, TAKEDA PHARMACEUTICALS NORTH AMERICA, INC. The logo features the word "Takeda" in a stylized font within a dark, elongated oval shape, with the full company name in capital letters below.::> November 18, 2002 David Orloff, M.D. Division of Metabolic & Endocrine Drug Products (HFD-510) Office of Drug Evaluation II Center for Drug Evaluation & Research Document Control Room 14B-19 Food and Drug Administration 5600 Fishers Lane Rockville, MD 20857 ACTOS® (pioglitazone HCl) Tablets, 15, 30 and 45-mg Serial No. 501 Response to FDA Request for Information Dear Dr. Orloff: Reference is made to a telephone conference call held between Drs. Orloff, Misbin and El-Hage and Ms. Jena Weber, of the Division and representatives from Takeda Pharmaceuticals North America, Inc. (TPNA) on July 31, August 13, November 1 and 6, 2002 and submissions made to the above noted IND on August 28, and September 27, 2002 (Serial Nos. 485 and 490, respectively). During the conference call with Division members on November 6th, Dr. Orloff requested that TPNA break the study medication blind on the two patients that were reported to the IND on September 27th. The purpose of this submission is to comply with the Division request. Information on these patients was previously submitted to the Agency in a blinded fashion as Serial Number 490. The case histories followed by the drug treatment are detailed below. Both patients have been discontinued from the study. Case Number One: A 58 year old male, enrolled in the study for 103 days, was hospitalized for a urinary tract obstruction, which was later diagnosed as bladder cancer. This patient had a two year intermittent history of hematuria with dysuria and urinary retention, urinary tract infections, hemorrhagic cysitis and enlarged prostate. The patient has been discontinued from the trial and there is no available information on tobacco use or exposure to other chemicals. Drug Treatment: Pioglitazone HCl <::attestation: Stamp Stamped Readable Text: EXHIBIT, Bhattacharya, 39, 10-27-13, ADDER A rectangular stamp with a thick black border, containing the word "EXHIBIT" at the top, followed by handwritten text "Bhattacharya", "39", and "10-27-13". The word "ADDER" is vertically oriented on the left side of the stamp. The stamp is centrally located in the image.::> 475 Half Day Road. Suite 500 Lincolnshire, Illinois 60069 Phone: 847-363-3000 Confidential -- Subject to Protective Order TAK-INDNDA-01273547 Produced in MDL on 09/11/2012 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/gyjf0226 P167900001

chunks.markdown: <::logo: Takeda Pharmaceuticals North America, Inc. Takeda, TAKEDA PHARMACEUTICALS NORTH AMERICA, INC. The logo features the word "Takeda" in a stylized font within a dark, elongated oval shape, with the full company name in capital letters below.::>

David Orloff, M.D. Division of Metabolic & Endocrine Drug Products (HFD-510) Office of Drug Evaluation II Center for Drug Evaluation & Research Document Control Room 14B-19 Food and Drug Administration 5600 Fishers Lane Rockville, MD 20857
ACTOS® (pioglitazone HCl) Tablets, 15, 30 and 45-mg Serial No. 501
Response to FDA Request for Information

Dear Dr. Orloff: Reference is made to a telephone conference call held between Drs. Orloff, Misbin and El-Hage and Ms. Jena Weber, of the Division and representatives from Takeda Pharmaceuticals North America, Inc. (TPNA) on July 31, August 13, November 1 and 6, 2002 and submissions made to the above noted IND on August 28, and September 27, 2002 (Serial Nos. 485 and 490, respectively).

During the conference call with Division members on November 6th, Dr. Orloff requested that TPNA break the study medication blind on the two patients that were reported to the IND on September 27th. The purpose of this submission is to comply with the Division request. Information on these patients was previously submitted to the Agency in a blinded fashion as Serial Number 490. The case histories followed by the drug treatment are detailed below. Both patients have been discontinued from the study.

Case Number One: A 58 year old male, enrolled in the study for 103 days, was hospitalized for a urinary tract obstruction, which was later diagnosed as bladder cancer. This patient had a two year intermittent history of hematuria with dysuria and urinary retention, urinary tract infections, hemorrhagic cysitis and enlarged prostate. The patient has been discontinued from the trial and there is no available information on tobacco use or exposure to other chemicals.

<::attestation: Stamp Stamped Readable Text: EXHIBIT, Bhattacharya, 39, 10-27-13, ADDER A rectangular stamp with a thick black border, containing the word "EXHIBIT" at the top, followed by handwritten text "Bhattacharya", "39", and "10-27-13". The word "ADDER" is vertically oriented on the left side of the stamp. The stamp is centrally located in the image.::>
475 Half Day Road. Suite 500 Lincolnshire, Illinois 60069 Phone: 847-363-3000
